title: thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is xxx but the index is xxx'

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
When I use rustc to compile the [TiKV](https://github.com/tikv/tikv) project, the compiler reported the following error: 
```shell
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 998 but the index is 18791998', /rustc/b2e36e6c2d229126b59e892c9147fbb68115d292/src/librustc_hir/definitions.rs:58:20
note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace
```
**A detailed description of this problem can be found in this [issue](https://github.com/tikv/tikv/issues/8153).**

The rust toolchain: **nightly-2020-04-23**


<details><summary>Backtrace</summary>

```
** ✘ ⚡ root@db-test-10-101-31-65  ~/tikv   master  RUST_BACKTRACE=1 make build
cargo build --no-default-features --features "jemalloc portable sse protobuf-codec"

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 998 but the index is 18791998', /rustc/b2e36e6c2d229126b59e892c9147fbb68115d292/src/librustc_hir/definitions.rs:58:20

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.44.0-nightly (b2e36e6c2 2020-04-22) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C bitcode-in-rlib=no -C codegen-units=4 -C debuginfo=1 -C overflow-checks=off -C incremental --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
end of query stack
error: could not compile `cdc`.

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
make: *** [Makefile:119: build] Error 101**
```
